abstract: The JPMorgan Chase chief executive officer was determined to expand on the West Coast, and Seattle-based WaMu, as it was called, was a prime target. In the end, he got what he wanted — and a lot that he didn’t want.
snippet: The JPMorgan Chase chief executive officer was determined to expand on the West Coast, and Seattle-based WaMu, as it was called, was a prime target. In the end, he got what he wanted — and a lot that he didn’t want.
lead_paragraph: Jamie Dimon, the chief executive of JPMorgan Chase, wanted Washington Mutual and he wanted it bad.

headline.main: Dimon’s Yoke: Bad Washington Mutual Loans
